newsitem.title: FRANCE: Elf workers to vote tonight on strike extension.
newsitem.headline: Elf workers to vote tonight on strike extension.

text.p: Striking Elf Aquitaine refinery workers will vote on Tuesday evening whether to keep up a six-day-old strike after unions and managers agreed to concrete negotiations from Thursday, union officials said.
One official predicted the strike would continue for now, with little emerging from Tuesday's talks besides the decision to hold a real bargaining session at 1300 GMT on Thursday.
"Nothing happened today. Probably the strike will be carried forward for another 24 hours," Claude Henry, strike coordinator at the CFTC, one of five unions involved, told Reuters.
Staff were due to vote starting from 2000 GMT, he said.
Three Elf refineries have been on strike since last week in a dispute over job cuts which has since expanded to include union demands for early retirement, higher pay and shorter hours.
The strike affects a quarter of French refining capacity.
